'John Winston Ono Lennon', (born 'John Winston Lennon'; 9 October 1940 â 8
December 1980) was an English musician, singer and songwriter who rose to
worldwide fame as a founder member  of the
Beatles, one of the most commercially successful and critically acclaimed acts
in the history of popular music. With Paul McCartney, he formed a songwriting
partnership that is one of the most celebrated of the 20th century.

Born and raised in Liverpool, as a teenager Lennon became involved in the
skiffle craze; his first band, the Quarrymen, evolved into the Beatles in 1960.
As the group disintegrated towards the end of the decade, Lennon embarked on a
solo career that produced the critically acclaimed albums [[John Lennon/Plastic
Ono Band]] and [[Imagine (album)|Imagine]], and iconic songs such as
